intro: Macairea duidae, commonly known as the Duidae's macairea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with a serrated edge. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
